title: Tech Beats Toys for Holidays Despite Covid Screen Fatigue
sub_head: Parents and children are at odds, as wish lists fill with game and app requests, not tangible toys
body:
This is the first year Heather Muhleman Jenkins’s son, Reid, hasn’t asked for toys for Christmas. The 6-year-old cut out a picture of a Nintendo Switch from a catalog, glued it to a piece of paper and handed it to his mom.
“He said, ‘If Santa doesn’t get me anything else, this is what I want,’ ” said Ms. Muhleman Jenkins, a public-relations...
